name: Prawn Curry
history: Prawn Curry is a popular dish in coastal regions of India, particularly in Goa and Kerala. Influenced by local and colonial culinary traditions, it's known for its rich and spicy flavors.
description: Prawn Curry is a flavorful seafood dish where prawns are simmered in a spiced coconut milk-based gravy. The curry is infused with traditional Indian spices, offering a perfect balance of heat and creaminess.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies, cooking until onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Dry Spices
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Cook the Prawns
instructions.description: Add prawns to the pan and cook for a few minutes until they start turning pink.

instructions.title: Add Coconut Milk and Tamarind
instructions.description: Pour in the coconut milk and tamarind paste. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the curry thickens and the prawns are fully cooked.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Add garam masala to the curry and stir well.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread.

tips: Cook the prawns just until they are pink to avoid overcooking them.
Adjust the amount of tamarind and chili to balance the tanginess and heat.
variations: Add vegetables like bell peppers or okra for extra texture.
Use fish or chicken instead of prawns for a different protein option.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with a slice of lemon.
Pair with a cooling cucumber salad.
